traits.description: Timmy enjoys the feeling of freedom that comes from being nude. he can handle clothing, but will be happier without it.
traits.name: nudist

traits.description: Timmy gets a rush from hurting people, and never minds the sight of blood or death. he is four times as likely to start a social fight as others.
traits.name: bloodlust

traits.description: Timmy is an exceptionally agreeable and giving person. he rarely insults others and will sometimes offer kind words to brighten the moods of those around him. he also never judges people by their appearance. his agreeableness also makes him more likely to conform to prevailing opinions.
traits.name: kind

traits.description: Timmy has no empathy. The suffering of others doesn't bother him at all. he doesn't mind if others are butchered, left unburied, imprisoned, or sold to slavery - unless it affects him. he also feels no mood boost from socializing.
traits.name: psychopath

traits.description: Timmy was taught that eating human meat is wrong and horrible. But one time, long ago, he tried it... and he liked it.
traits.name: cannibal

traits.description: Timmy always says exactly what's on his mind, especially if it's bugging him. That tends to rub people the wrong way.
traits.name: abrasive

traits.description: Timmy is too smart for his own good. he learns everything much faster than everyone, but can be quite eccentric.
traits.name: toosmart

traits.description: Timmy likes to fight up close and personal. his accuracy is greatly increased in melee combat, but he'll be very unhappy if asked to carry a ranged weapon.
traits.name: brawler

traits.description: For Timmy, there's something exciting about getting hurt. he doesn't know why, he's just wired differently.
traits.name: masochist

traits.description:
Timmy likes to be up during the night, and sleep during the day.

he gets a mood bonus if awake at night (23h-6h) and mood loss if awake during the day (11h-18h).

he doesn't get a mood penalty for being in the dark.
traits.name: nightowl

traits.description: Timmy needs a really impressive bedroom. he gets a mood loss if he doesn't get what he wants.
traits.name: greedy

traits.description: For Timmy, it's degrading to have a less impressive bedroom than someone else. he gets a mood loss if any colonist has a more impressive bedroom.
traits.name: jealous

traits.description: Timmy has forsaken physical comforts and enjoyments in favor of a simple, pure lifestyle. he will become unhappy if he has a bedroom that's too impressive. he also dislikes fancy food and prefers to eat raw. he never judges others by their appearance.
traits.name: ascetic

traits.description: Timmy is romantically attracted to people of his own gender.
traits.name: gay

traits.description: Timmy is romantically attracted to both men and women.
traits.name: bisexual

traits.description: Timmy has no sexual attraction to anyone at all.
traits.name: asexual

traits.description: Timmy's voice has a particularly grating, nasal quality to it, and he tends to talk in barked, garbled phrases. This predisposes others to dislike him.
traits.name: annoyingvoice

traits.description: Timmy breathes heavily all the time, and sweats constantly. People find it creepy.
traits.name: creepybreathing

traits.description: Timmy loves fire. he will never extinguish fires, and will occasionally go on random fire starting sprees. he will be happy around flames, and happier when wielding an incendiary weapon.
traits.name: pyromaniac

traits.description: Timmy is weak and cowardly. Even a little pain will immobilize him.
traits.name: wimp

traits.description: Timmy has remarkable kinesthetic intelligence. he seems to dance around danger with preternatural grace.
traits.name: nimble

traits.description: Timmy has a knack for learning. he picks things up much faster than others.
traits.name: fastlearner

traits.description: Timmy is slow on the uptake. he learns much slower than others.
traits.name: slowlearner

traits.description: Timmy has no need to experience the outdoors or light. he will never feel cooped up or get cabin fever and is not bothered by darkness. However, Timmy will be unhappy while outdoors.
traits.name: undergrounder

traits.description: Timmy feels limited in his feeble human body. he often dreams of being enhanced with artificial body parts or xenogenetics.
traits.name: bodymodder

traits.description: Timmy believes the human body is limited for a reason. To him, artificial body parts and xenogenes are unethical and disgusting.
traits.name: bodypurist

traits.description: Timmy really dislikes and distrusts men.
traits.name: misandrist

traits.description: Timmy really dislikes and distrusts women.
traits.name: misogynist

traits.description: Timmy has a fantastic memory for detail. he will lose unused skills at half the rate of other people.
traits.name: greatmemory

traits.description: Timmy has thick skin, dense flesh, and durable bones. he takes much less damage than other people from the same blows. he is extremely hard to kill.
traits.name: tough

traits.description: Timmy feels alienated and misunderstood by other human beings. he will have a constant mood debuff, but gain a chance (50%) to get a creativity inspiration after a mental break.
traits.name: torturedartist

traits.description: Timmy's life revolves around food. he gets hungry quickly, and will occasionally be overcome with the urge to eat ravenously, even when not hungry.
traits.name: gourmand

traits.description: Timmy doesn't need as much sleep as the average person. Whether he's sleeping on a bed or on the ground, he will be fully rested in about two thirds the usual time.
traits.name: quicksleeper

traits.description: Timmy is always falling behind the group whenever he goes anywhere.
traits.name: slowpoke

traits.description: Timmy likes to be where he's going. he walks quicker than most people.
traits.name: fastwalker

traits.description: Timmy always moves with a sense of urgency - so much so that others often fail to keep up.
traits.name: jogger

traits.description: Timmy is utterly fascinated with chemical sources of enjoyment. Consuming recreational drugs will create a good mood, while abstaining will lead to increasing frustration over time and possibly drug binges. he will ignore directives to not use recreational drugs, and will consume more than a normal person.
traits.name: chemicalfascination

traits.description: Timmy has an unusual interest in chemical sources of enjoyment. Consuming recreational drugs will create a good mood, while abstaining will lead to increasing frustration over time and possible drug binges. he will ignore directives to not use recreational drugs, and will consume more than a normal person.
traits.name: chemicalinterest

traits.description: Timmy abhors the idea of gaining pleasure from chemicals. he strictly avoids alcohol and recreational drugs.
stats: Binging on drug mental state disabled.
Binging on drug mental state disabled.
Binging on drug mental state disabled.
Binging on drug mental state disabled.

traits.name: teetotaler

traits.description: Timmy is just naturally upbeat about his situation, pretty much all the time, no matter what it is.
traits.name: sanguine

traits.description: Timmy is naturally optimistic about life. It's hard to get him down.
traits.name: optimist

traits.description: Timmy tends to look on the bad side of life.
traits.name: pessimist

traits.description: Timmy is perenially unhappy. he has trouble sustaining a good mood even when everything is fine.
traits.name: depressive

traits.description: Timmy's will is an iron shield. he keeps going through thick and thin, when others broke down long before.
traits.name: iron-willed

traits.description: Timmy is mentally tough and won't break down under stresses that would crack most people.
traits.name: steadfast

traits.description: Timmy tends to crack under pressure.
traits.name: nervous

traits.description: Timmy is on a hair-trigger all the time. he is the first to break in any tough situation.
traits.name: volatile

traits.description: Timmy likes to have things squared away. he will work harder than most to attain this state of affairs, but his nerves can get the better of him.
traits.name: neurotic

traits.description: Timmy feels constantly nervous about everything that has to get done. he will work extremely hard to attain this state of affairs, but his nerves can easily get the better of him.
traits.name: veryneurotic

traits.description: Timmy has an easy time staying on-task and focused, and gets things done much faster than the average person.
traits.name: industrious

traits.description: Timmy is a natural hard worker and will finish tasks faster than most.
traits.name: hardworker

traits.description: Timmy is a little bit lazy.
traits.name: lazy

traits.description: Timmy loves idleness and hates anything productive. he moves slowly and rarely stays focused on a task.
traits.name: slothful

traits.description: Timmy's mind is like a psychic tuning fork. he is extremely sensitive to psychic phenomena.
traits.name: psychicallyhypersensitive

traits.description: Timmy's mind is unusually sensitive to psychic phenomena.
traits.name: psychicallysensitive

traits.description: Timmy's mind is psychically out of tune with others. he isn't as affected by psychic phenomena.
traits.name: psychicallydull

traits.description: Timmy's mind works on a psychic frequency different from everyone else. he just isn't affected by psychic phenomena.
traits.name: psychicallydeaf

traits.description: Timmy takes more time to aim when shooting. he shoots less often than others, but with more accuracy.
traits.name: carefulshooter

traits.description: Pew! Pew! Pew! Timmy just likes pulling the trigger. he shoots faster than others, but less accurately.
traits.name: trigger-happy

traits.description: Timmy is exceptionally beautiful, with an exotic-yet-familiar facial structure and an arresting gaze. People are attracted to him before he even opens his mouth.
traits.name: beautiful

traits.description: Timmy has a pretty face, which predisposes people to like him.
traits.name: pretty

traits.description: Timmy is somewhat ugly. This subtly repels others during social interactions.
traits.name: ugly

traits.description: Timmy is staggeringly ugly. his face looks like a cross between a drawing by an untalented child, a malformed fetus in a jar of formaldehyde, and a piece of modern art. Others must exert conscious effort to look at him while conversing.
traits.name: staggeringlyugly

traits.description: Timmy has a naturally powerful immune system. he will gain immunity much faster than a normal person would, and can survive illnesses that would kill others.
traits.name: super-immune

traits.description: Timmy has an awful immune system. he gets sick more often than usual, frequently with illnesses that nobody in the colony has been afflicted by.
traits.name: sickly

traits.description: Timmy has fragile skin and bones. he takes more damage than other people from the same blows.
traits.name: delicate

traits.description: The fewer people in Timmy's faction, the happier he is. Being alone is best of all.
traits.name: recluse

traits.description: Timmy has outstanding memory, both in terms of retaining information but also muscle memory. his skills will never decay.
traits.name: perfectmemory

traits.description: Timmy has deep knowledge of the twisted patterns of dark psychic energy. he can study unnatural entities faster than others. he will also periodically teach this inhuman knowledge to others when he gets the chance.
traits.name: occultist

traits.description: Timmy has the ability to make everyone feel better and inspire them to be the best version of themselves.
traits.name: joyous

traits.description: Timmy doesn't have basic needs like eating, sleeping, or comfort. his body is driven by some unknown mechanism, which has turned his eyes completely white.
traits.name: bodymastery

traits.description: Timmy is a peculiar person who seems fixated on horrendous ideas. Talking to him is often upsetting.
traits.name: disturbing

traits.description: Timmy is strangely intrigued by unnatural entities and is easily enthralled by them.
traits.name: voidfascination

traits.description: Timmy hates and distrusts xenos. They see them as little more than animals.
traits.name: xenophobe

traits.description: Timmy thinks aliens are exotic and interesting. They would love to get to know them more and wouldn't mind forming relationships with them.
traits.name: xenophile

traits.description: Psychic enthrallment caused by incredibly strong mental influence. Thralls don't need to sleep or have recreation, but are unable to do skilled work and engage in social interactions.
traits.name: thrall

traits.description: Timmy tends to occasionally allow their mind to drift, even in the middle of working.
traits.name: absent-minded

traits.description: Timmy has a loose screw or two, a small trade off for being naturally scientifically inclined.
traits.name: eccentric

traits.description: Timmy strives for perfection in his work. They will naturally produce better quality products at the expense of time. However, making a low quality product will upset them. Additionally, they may very rarely quit a project mid attempt if they don't like the direction its going in.
traits.name: perfectionist

traits.description: While fully capable of warfare in theory, Timmy's fight or flight instincts heavily lean towards flight, and he will try to hide or run as a first priority.
traits.name: coward

traits.description: Timmy has a higher mental and physical fortitude compared to most and can more readily adapt to harsh environments in the rimworlds.
traits.name: brave

traits.description: Minor bruises and scrapes plague Timmy all too often, mostly due to uncoordinated tripping or falling.
traits.name: clumsy

traits.description: Timmy loves the brightness and heat of a dry summer day. They don't mind working up a sweat or sleeping in the warmth either.
traits.name: heatinclined

traits.description: Timmy loves the overcast and cold of a brisk winter night. They don't mind getting chilly or sleeping in the cold either.
traits.name: coldinclined

traits.description: A bomb could go off next to Timmy while they sleep and they'd continue to do so. They can't be bothered to defend the colony mid catnap, either.
traits.name: heavysleeper

traits.description: Timmy is naturally hygenic and organized. They will not track in dirt or throw trash anywhere, and feel happy while cleaning.
traits.name: neat

traits.description: Timmy is sloppy naturally and leaves trash and dirt everywhere it seems. At least they're not much bothered by messes.
traits.name: slob

traits.description: Timmy has problems taking breaks or resting mid job. he will continue to work even sacrificing their health or sleep.
traits.name: workaholic

traits.description: Timmy has never felt nausea in his life. Throwing up or food poisoning is foreign to him.
traits.name: ironstomach

traits.description: Timmy can't stand mistreatment of animals. he will feel happier being nuzzled or being a master to a bonded animal, but will be more deeply crushed when not master of a bonded animal or seeing one die. They also refuse to butcher.
traits.name: animallover

traits.description: Timmy believes deeply in human superiority. Killing animals will please them and the colony losing an animal is a cherry on top according to them.
traits.name: animalhater

traits.description: Whether because they're a bit chunky or because they shift their weight oddly, Timmy has broken a few chairs in their time and is likely to break more.
traits.name: big-boned

traits.description: Timmy only plays by their own rules, and will roll their eyes and take it easy while doing any task they've been forced to do.
traits.name: rebel

traits.description: Timmy needs clear instructions on how, and when to do certain things and will only work at a normal speed when being forced to do something.
traits.name: submissive

traits.description: Timmy is fueled by spite. They can't stand walking on the same soil as their rivals and will be elated by news of their life ending.
traits.name: vengeful

traits.description: Whether by past trauma or fear of change, Timmy rejects modernity. They may randomly punch or attack mechanical devices and refuse to learn or research anything about them. They also love killing mechanoids.
traits.name: technophobe

traits.description: Timmy always recalls the good times and lives to party, any party attended will be remembered for many times longer than most.
traits.name: fun-loving

traits.description: Timmy has hindered mental capacities. While slow to learn and hard to speak with, they tend to be much happier naturally.
traits.name: dunce

traits.description: Timmy learned a specific move in melee combat which allows them to disarm opponents and will use it frequently.
traits.name: martialartist

traits.description: Timmy believes they belong in high society, and loves nothing more than critiquing art and brushing elbows with royalty.
traits.name: snob

traits.description: Sour stomach plagues Timmy any time they're around too much blood or rotting corpses. Vomiting is just part of life for him.
traits.name: squeamish

traits.description: Timmy feels naturally anxious, but especially from social situations. They will not attend any gatherings and may occasionally need alone time in their room to breathe.
traits.name: anxious

traits.description: No amount of lovin' is enough lovin' for Timmy. he will tend to jump from partner to partner and tumble between the sheets with them frequently.
traits.name: insatiable

traits.description: Timmy refuses to give their body to anybody but their spouse and would never fathom initiating a divorce. They also hate being nude much more than other pawns.
traits.name: prude

traits.description: An armchair and flatscreen is all Timmy needs to be happy. Even reruns or ancient commercials are entertaining to them, they will never grow bored of television and tend to watch it more, as well as feel pleased after doing so.
traits.name: couchpotato

traits.description: Timmy is mad for all things feline. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with cats, however they're not a fan of dogs.
traits.name: catperson

traits.description: Timmy is mad for all things canine. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with dogs, however they're not a fan of cats.
traits.name: dogperson

traits.description: Timmy is a natural scientist. They research much faster and recall things better. However, they'll be upset without a laboratory dedicated to their work and tend to stress out more frequently.
traits.name: prodigy

traits.description: Timmy believes animals are integral to the way society and life functions from furry friends to sources of food. They love having as many as possible and are particularly good at taming and training them.
traits.name: menagerist

traits.description: The sea calls to Timmy. he feels happier just being near the ocean or a deep river.
traits.name: oceanlover

traits.description: The mountains call to Timmy. he feels happier just being near a large mountain.
traits.name: mountainlover

traits.description: Timmy has a twisted secret. he treats organ harvesting like a sick experiment, and does not even blink at the idea. While harvesting one will make them happy, going too long without giving in to their compulsion will upset them.
traits.name: madsurgeon

traits.description: Timmy is supposedly a hand-to-hand combat specialist, but only when inebriated. They claim to become more talented the more drunk they are.
traits.name: drunkenmaster

traits.description: Timmy is compulsive to steal and take things that don't belong to them, even if it means angering the other party.
traits.name: kleptomaniac

traits.description: Smokeleaf culture is just part of life for Timmy. he absolutely adores smokeleaf and would rather die before giving it up.
traits.name: stoner

traits.description: Alcohol culture is just part of life for Timmy. he absolutely adores booze and would rather die before giving it up.
traits.name: lush

traits.description: Timmy loves to travel and does so swiftly, but can grow upset if they haven't done so in a while. They are also quite adept at foraging while traveling.
traits.name: wanderlust

traits.description: Timmy is never really asleep or awake. he is almost zombie like, lurching along and working very slowly, and will only sleep once every three days or so.
traits.name: insomniac

traits.description: Timmy has grown tired of the world and needs to be constantly distracted to stop dark thoughts. his bleak personality is a big downer and therefore it is very hard to become friends with them.
traits.name: worldweary

traits.description: Timmy is hardened through what can only be presumed as old emotional trauma. They feel absolutely nothing from lost animals, colonists, family, prisoners or dead bodies.
traits.name: desensitized

traits.description: Only the finest of culinary creations may grace the lips of Timmy. They feel neutral towards mundane meals, but will laud and savour lavish meals down to the last bite.
traits.name: refinedpalate

traits.description: Whether through studying ancient manuscripts or years of scholastic pursuit Timmy is surprisingly well read on a variety of topics, particularly science and medical practice.
traits.name: academian

traits.description: Timmy strongly believes infrastucture rules all and is a natural born stoneworker.
traits.name: groundbreaker

traits.description: In the eyes of Timmy food is art, their culinary creations are incredibly beautiful, amazing to taste, and almost always safe to eat.
traits.name: gastronomist

traits.description: Flora and fauna are both vital to Timmy. They use all parts of plants and animals and strongly appreciate mother Gaia's blessings.
traits.name: ecologist

traits.description: Timmy has an eye for silver and a tongue made from it. They believe their products are the best products and he will likely convince you if given the chance.
traits.name: tycoon

traits.description: Timmy is strangely hypercoagulating and will bleed much more slowly than most.
traits.name: thickskinned

traits.description: Timmy is strangely hemophilic and tends to bleed much more profusely than others.
traits.name: thinskinned

traits.description: Timmy has trouble expressing themselves until its all too much to bear, whereafter they will have an utter meltdown.
traits.name: schizoid

traits.description: Timmy's voice has a particularly Beautiful. This predisposes others to like him.
traits.name: beautifulvoice

traits.description: Timmy is a biotic god.
traits.name: bioticgod

traits.description: Timmys biotic capabilities are significantly dampened by past trauma, or simply the lack of predisposition.
traits.name: bioticallydeaf

traits.description: Timmy has not yet unlocked their full biotic potential, and most likely never will.
traits.name: bioticallydull

traits.description: Timmys biotic skills are greatly above average, allowing them to use the power without any fear of migraines or discomfort.
traits.name: bioticallyskilled

traits.description: Timmys biotic skills are known far and wide across the galaxy due to their talent and rare predisposition.
traits.name: bioticallytalented

traits.description: Timmy has charisma befitting one a god's child and can befriend anyone.
traits.name: divinedaughter

traits.description: Beauty has a tendency to drive one mad. Should that beauty be devilish, it can even break one's dignity.
traits.name: witch

traits.description: Timmy is a Demon of the Night Winds.
traits.name: ardatyakshi

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description: It is a beautiful creature with human and dragon characteristics. It is mainly seen in the wild. Their silver-haired fur is hard and soft, making them expensive on the black market and often a target for hunters.
races.name: Dragonian

races.description: Miko serves and manages the village as a kind of duty for Yuran belonging to a family of special lineage.
races.name: Yuran Miko

races.description:
Yuran is an Ain race with the appearance of a rabbit, and its origin is not known precisely.
As a minority race with a small population, there are genetic problems and males do not exist. It continues.
Centering on the Miko with special abilities that are passed on through blood lineage, they live in a small village-sized village and have faith in the large cherry tree in their hometown.
races.name: Yuran

races.description:
She is Miko who is fluent in curses.
According to the record, she even overcame death.
races.name: Yuran BlackSnake

races.description:
Shadow-bending humanoids with an affinity for ethereal manipulation - the chaoura. Their abilities derive from data gathered on super-entities discovered through the littluna.

Concepts beyond human understanding - like imaginary numbers and chaos - come naturally to chaoura. Of these, they have a particular affinity for the elusive truth behind shadow itself.

Chaoura have a marvelous utility organ that exploits phenomena manipulated by super-entities. This organ activates in darkness, bolstering its owner's abilities.

Most attacks can't affect a chaoura under the cover of darkness. They can also evade perception and teleport through imaginary space when in darkness. In nighttime engagements, chaoura thus present an unprecedented threat. 

Contact with hostile chaoura results in a phenomenon known as "abyssal inflammation." This causes outbreaks of painful boils that each weaken the body separately. 

The strengths of chaouran physiology don't come without costs, however. Any equipment with physical protection disrupts their ability to blend in with shadows. As such, they must rely on specialized weapons and apparel. Since the latter can't protect them, they're also vulnerable outside of darkness. 

Direct exposure to sunlight weakens chaoura by paralyzing their utility organs. As such, most chaoura exhibit sleep inversion.
races.name: chaoura

races.description:
The ancient prototypes of the ishmuti clade - the "Simulacrum Race Eveliet", or simply eveliet. Before the Creator perfected requeen-based mass production of ishmuti, the eveliet served as a proof of concept.

Compared to their successors, an eveliet's genetic structure retains a far higher purity of super-entity data. They are thus highly unstable organisms. Their bodies couldn't even develop naturally from fetuses, so they were created in a near-adult state. For safety, they ordinarily reserve their full strength, thus differing little from baseline humans in ability. 

Eveliet have two types of outer frames to support their unstable bodies. The first, "K'lipa Repha'im", is a kind of armor that stores auxiliary power. The second, "Shahar Helev," are swords for collecting blood to power K'lipa Repha'im.

Given their purpose, the Creator only made a single eveliet. She was later revered by the ishmuti as the Creator's eldest daughter. However, she was unable to accept the transition of authority from the Creator to the qualeelan monarchy. Spearheading a rebellion, she used her accumulated blood to reduce the royal family's numbers by half. Nonetheless, her natural enemy, the idhale, managed to halt her advance. She met her eventual end to the great spear of the Divine Daughter's knight.

The eveliet known today represent an improved redesign by the Divine Daughter. Though less powerful than their originator, they are considerably more stable.

Eveliet can expend blood collected from other creatures to utilize additional power. Though blood is a finite resource, eveliet abilities have very short cooldown periods. They can thus be used repeatedly so long as blood remains.
races.name: eveliet

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Laches idearn could be considered a baseline model, as their capabilities are rather plain compared to their kin. Nonetheless, Laches idearn still outperform human beings in most tasks by a large margin.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Laches)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Charmides-A idearn specialize in melee combat. Compared to the Laches model, Charmides-A have more robust armor.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Charmides-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Charmides-B idearn are melee specialists that rely on their agility in combat. Compared to the Laches model, Charmides-B are quicker and somewhat better armored.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Charmides-B)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Menexenus-A idearn specialize in area-effect disruption, weakening nearby enemies using aerosolized mechanites. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to some extent, halving incoming damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Menexenus-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Menexenus-B idearn use their agile bodies to quickly close in on enemy ranks before covering the area in fire and EMP blasts. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to some extent, halving incoming damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Menexenus-B)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Theaetetus-A idearn are high-spec tactician models that incorporate certain design traits of the requeen. They can enhance the capabilities of nearby allies using aerosolized mechanites and summon large numbers of melee-capable subordinates. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to outright avoid damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Theaetetus-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the ishmuti clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Theaetetus-B idearn are elite models that incorporate certain design traits of the qualeela. They can disperse deadly mechanites that will lay waste to any enemies in their vicinity. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to outright avoid most damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Theaetetus-B)

races.description:
Recreations of the a self-sustaining superweapon in ishmutian form - the Idearn Critias. Their name derives from the title of their predecessor - "Decisive Autonomous Superhunter Critias." Long ago, that Critias destroyed the Creator and threatened all ishmuti with extinction.

Long ago, other interstellar factions began to fear the Creator's technology. Seizing the Mysterion onboard the Critias, they hastily activated the weapon. But in its unfinished state, it went out of control. It wreaked havoc across many worlds before the ishmuti, led by the qualeela, finally destroyed it.

The specter of Critias left lasting scars upon the collective ishmutian consciousness. The nearmare became hateful toward all mechanical beings. The silkiera became fascinated by the sheer power of the weapon. The qualeela, obsessed with preventing the weapon's rebirth, began enforcing their supremacist policies.

Yet it seems that Critias itself foresaw its eventual destruction. Planning for resurrection, it implanted its own cells in other machines as it crossed the stars. It fabricated false data about the idearn - a race that never existed - to elude the notice of Entelecheia. 

Tucked away as they are, these mysteries would draw the attention of those hungry for power and knowledge. Critias predicted that this fact alone could drive its resurrection. Clearly, the Idearn Critias prove that prediction. 

"With our wings rested, it's time for the next star-crossing massacre."

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: Idearn Critias

races.description:
Small humanoids with enhanced intelligence and remarkable summoning abilities - the littluna.

Littluna bring the same summoning principles used by the nearmare to their limit. As a result, they can summon so-called super-entities from the depths of space.

When wielding their abilities properly, a single littluna can destroy entire settlements. This earns them the title of "war-ender."

Though powerful summoners, littluna themselves are vulnerable to damage and disease. They thus depend on the support of others to thrive. A littluna's summoning abilities also take a long time to recharge. Thus, they aren't well suited to handling short-term emergencies or consecutive battles. 

Some societies treat littluna as weapons of war. Others choose to honor littlunan personhood where their Creator refused to. Ultimately, those who protect the littluna must also decide their fate.
races.name: littluna

races.description:
The Creator's icon for mending splintered bonds among ishmuti - the "Divine Daughter Race Dunamis." The Dunamis' design incorporated genetic material directly from the Creator. The ishmuti thus revere them as his authentic god-children to this day. 

The first Dunamis held the penultimate rank among ishmuti, second only to the other god-child - the original eveliet. Following the clade's Great War, she served as a symbol of Qualeelan royal power and the second generation head of the Church of Aletheia.

As beings designed with sophisticated mental abilities, all Dunamis share a kind of collective consciousness. Their special ability, termed "Reverence of Thought", lets them invite others to a timeless space for communication. Dunamis can befriend anyone in this space. This might occur over the course of a few minutes or over tens of thousands of years.

Despite their mental strength, a Dunamis' constitution is even weaker than that of their common counterpart. They thus require even more dedicated support to thrive.

Even after the Creator's fall in the Great War, Dunamis continued to exert their power as Divine Daughters. In time, they were driven to extinction, slaughtered by their own knights. It remains unknown why these knights, whom the Dunamis trusted more than any other, would commit such wanton acts.

Though as faithful a recreation as possible, this Dunamis' performance is not quite on par with the original's.
races.name: Littluna Dunamis

races.description: Littlunan Elites of unknown origin - the Littluna Ideasklavos. They resemble the "Divine Daughter Race Littluna Dunamis," legendary littlunan Elites. It remains uncertain what causes a littluna to develop into an Ideasklavos. It's said that Littluna Dunamis could harness the power of higher beings. Littluna Ideasklavos are known to inherit this ability. Yet other than that, their kind remain curiously undocumented and seldom spotted. Only scattered and anecdotal reports persist about the Ideasklavos. "She went mad" or "she became a monster," say some. "We all spewed blood and collapsed," swear others. ORCINUS BRIGADE EXCLUSIVE EXTERMINATION PROTOCOL: LITTLUNA IDEASKLAVOS (1) Excluding decoy operations, never directly approach the target. (2) Prioritize rescue of any allies subjected to the target's influence. NOTE: Does not apply in enemy territory. (3) Prefer weaponry with a high rate of fire to powerful yet slow arms. (4) Prefer to engage the target on open ground to avoid severe collateral structure damage. (5) When possible, request the support of the brigade chief. (6) The target is no longer a littluna. Spare it only the mercy of death.
races.name: Littluna Ideasklavos

races.description:
Horned, winged humanoids with enhanced intelligence and remarkable psychic capabilities - the nearmare. They were apparently engineered by an enigmatic entity simply known as the Creator.

Nearmare were designed as biological weapons of psychic disruption. Unfortunately, their abilities proved unsuitable for weaponization. Most nearmare were thus trained as covert operations "intelligence specialists." This was a privileged position, guaranteeing abundant comforts and a high education. Nearmare are also notable for being generally favorable toward humanity.

Eventually, internal conflict crumbled the society which supported the nearmare. Survivors fled to smaller societies, using their psychic abilities to blend in. This, along with their unique reproduction cycles, allowed the nearmare to evade extinction.

Nearmare must carry psychic amplifier weapons to manifest their many psychic abilities. Among these is the power to summon ethereal entities to fight at their behest. They're also capable of voluntarily inflicting a variety of disruptive psychic ailments on their foes. However, a nearmare's physical capabilities are inferior to those of most other races. As such, they are at their strongest when cooperating with others.
races.name: nearmare

races.description:
Nearmare Devouts are variants of nearmare possessing enhanced capabilities. Nearmare become Devouts through intense training that leads to a series of transformations. Whether by prerequisite or as a result, all Devouts have profound faith in their enigmatic Creator.

Compared to ordinary nearmare, Devouts have much greater psychic sensitivity and endurance. Furthermore, they can summon resilient shades of past Devouts as allies in combat.
races.name: nearmare Devout

races.description:
The ishmutian Creator's finalization of the nearmare - the "Phantom Race Nearmare Aradia." Their development required data obtained from ishmuti created after the nearmare. So feared are the Nearmare Aradia's powers among ishmuti that their name alone is taboo. For this reason, they are sometimes instead called "Coffin Ones." 

Nearmare Aradia are no more resilient to damage than a human. Still, their psychic and summoning abilities far exceed those of their common cousins. They can even produce various types of targeted energy blasts at range.

Able to manipulate anomalous phenomena as if by magic, Nearmare Aradia are often compared to witches. It's said that in the Creator's age, they served as the dedicated leaders of all nearmare. In this unique position, they took their orders from the Creator alone. Thus, the Nearmare Aradia never recognized the authority of the Royals.

When the Creator fell, the Nearmare Aradia began wielding their powers freely. In time, this gave rise to terrible calamities across various worlds. The three major ishmutian factions thus came together to prevent further disasters. They debated possible plans of action, even considering total extermination. But in the end, they decided on mercy, sealing away the Nearmare Aradia in special coffins.

Nearmare Aradia removed from their coffins tend to behave as reasonable, intellectual people. Excelling in research and medicine, they often become well-respected members of their societies. Yet none can grasp their true nature, nor understand what lies in their hearts. Moreover, their devilish beauty will threaten to tear their peers' relationships apart.

Nearmare Aradia are capable of a terrifying summoning act termed the "Forbidden Summon." Be sure the vicinity is clear of friendly people and animals before using it.
races.name: Nearmare Aradia

races.description:
A mysterious nearmare with a distinct atmosphere. She calls herself "Wingate," but no database mentions such a race. Though she claims to possess "a body and soul with two separate names," nothing else is known about her.

Her skills and knowledge suggest a background in biology, though she is also familiar with medicine. She's capable of collecting medicinal precursors from corpses, which she can derive into helpful potions for the colony's benefit.

Despite claiming to be a nearmare, she doesn't exhibit their signature ability to summon ethereal entities. However, her physical constitution is on par with that of a human. Possessing a wealth of personal experience and mental fortitude, all but the most dire circumstances won't phase her.


Old records mention a woman called Wingate who served as the Creator's assistant. After her death, reports began of nearmare suddenly changing in character, as though they'd become entirely different people.

Whether these events are connected or not... remains shrouded in mystery.
races.name: Nearmare Wingate

races.description:
A subrace of nearmare created by the Littluna Dunamis - the Nearmare Nemeseia. They are notable for their "Hestia Furnace" auxiliary organs, and for their adaptability across various battlefields.
	
Their Hestia Furnaces permit them to summon complex machinery - a more difficult feat than summoning ordinary ethereal entities. Their high affinity for machines also bolsters weapon handling.

To summon machinery, Nearmare Nemeseia require energy that slowly recharges over time. Though capable of generating energy at a quicker rate, this increases hunger rate.

A Nearmare Nemeseia's basic constitution is superior to their common counterpart's, but differs little from the human baseline. They compensate by equipping themselves with cutting-edge technology.

Most Nearmare Nemeseia belong to -ETHOS-, a "Frontier World Preservation Organization" responsible for monitoring isolated worlds. Those active on the rimworlds are bound to encounter these women.
races.name: Nearmare Nemeseia

races.description:
Humanoid bioweapons sporting wings and a cephalopodic lower body - the neclose. Genome sequencing suggests they are a genetic derivative of the nearmare.

The creators of the neclose designed them as low-cost, high-performance soldiers. Thus, neclose have both high unarmed combat potential and specialized psychic abilities. Much like their predecessors, neclose can summon ethereal entities to fight for them.

The neclose also enjoy mutualism with a unique strain of psychically-attuned bacteria. These bacteria bolster the neclose's combat lethality and support all their bodily systems. The bacteria are also capable of affecting their host's psyche and thrive on a diet of flesh. As a result, neclose develop positive associations with meat and corpses of any kind.

Besides spreading disease to organics, neclosian attacks are capable of disabling mechanoids. Moreover, neclose tend to be long-lived and their bacterial mutualism makes them disease-resistant. Unfortunately, neclose make poor laborers, as they lack dexterity and hold disdain for non-combat tasks. That lack of dexterity also means they are entirely incapable of using weapons. Finally, the large, tentacled bodies of the neclose limit their mobility.
races.name: neclose

races.description:
A frightening deviant form of the neclose - the Neclose Outisphonia. Following the ishmuti clade's Great War, they came about suddenly in the Canaan system's space station. Though they resemble ishmuti, the Creator's databanks hold no record of them.

Neclose Outisphonia do not possess the unique "Beresheet" gene common to other ishmuti. Nonetheless, they are technically considered as such due to their close genetic resemblance to the neclose. These traits have earned them recognition as a feared "invasive species" among ishmuti.

Outisphonia infestation forced the abandonment of the Canaanite space station. Even now it drifts among the stars, blindly following its autopilot protocols.

Ever since, Outisphonia have made their appearance in many systems, becoming a menace across the stars. Their capabilities are poorly understood, making any encounter highly dangerous.


The Canaanite space station contained a "unique super-entity sample." It's known that the Creator placed this sample in the neclose's care, but the details remain shrouded in mystery.
races.name: Neclose Outisphonia

races.description:
The more common, versatile variety of the angelic humanoids called qualeela. The qualeela-genus are mass-produced variants of their parent race, the Qualeela-Keter. Originally born from vast bioengineering plants, qualeela-genus exist to bolster the qualeelan population.

Compared to their predecessors, qualeela-genus are generalists. Their defensive capabilities are respectable, even boasting the total fire immunity of the Qualeela-Keter. At the same time, their labor potential is about on par with a human's. Yet the qualeela-genus lack Regalia, and thus cannot invoke the ishmutian Creator's power.
races.name: qualeela-genus

races.description:
The rare royal variant of the angelic humanoids called qualeela. Qualeela-Keter descend from qualeela directly engineered by the ishmutian Creator. They were made to inherit their fallen Creator's role as an all-powerful authority. On many worlds, they now serve to protect and unite ishmuti across the clade.

Qualeela-Keter enforce their reign with "Regalia" - reality-bending devices integrated into their bodies. Regalia permit their user to invoke the Creator's wrath at will. However, Regalia were still under development when the Creator fell. In their incomplete state, they can manifest only 50% of their intended potential.

Compared to humans, Qualeela-Keter are twice as resilient, immune to fire, and equal in physical strength. And though their Regalia are fearsome tools of war, they strain the qualeelan mind and body. This apparently renders them abysmal workers, sensitive to both pain and psychic phenomena.
races.name: Qualeela-Keter

races.description:
Selfless, mothlike humanoids - the saclean. The silkieran corporation Ajin Company engineered the saclean based on the silkiera genome. Saclean have fragile bodies, and are mentally incapable of violent acts of any kind.

Created as a so-called "service species," the saclean act as sapient livestock. They naturally produce nutritious milk and a strong, weavable thread called silk filament. Saclean are generally milked every two days and their thread spooled every season.

Saclean are mentally hardened and placid by nature. They tolerate harsh working conditions well, and are even capable of blocking pain on reflex.
races.name: saclean

races.description: Elegant mono-gender race. Native to the planet Thessia, Asari are often considered the most influential and respected sentient species in the galaxy, and are known for their, diplomacy and biotic aptitude. Asari can often use biotic powers without the need of biotic amplifiers.
races.name: asari

races.description: A humanoid species with regenerative abilities, harboring potent internal energy.
races.name: MoeLotl

races.description:
An ancient species that soars through the skies, the elves of the heavens, known as Milira. Characterized by their pure white wings and the diverse auras that crown their heads, they are often mistaken for angels and have been worshipped by many humans.

      In the distant past, the Milira were strong and warlike. They seemed to be born for battle, relying on their innate combat instincts and superior physical capabilities. They excelled at using swift and fierce close combat, as well as devastating spells to shatter their enemies, thus dominating their realm.
      
      However, after vanquishing all their formidable foes, the Milira gradually lost the meaning of battle. The race needed to find a new purpose for existence. But with their exceedingly long lifespans, the Milira's interest in anything could be worn away by the passage of time, leaving only the unfathomable sea of knowledge that continually drew them to explore.
      
      Gradually, the Milira ceased to yearn for battle and began to pursue knowledge. They collected languages and texts from various races, observed every corner of the world; built floating cities, and established libraries to store their accumulating wisdom. Over time, the combat skills of the Milira were buried deep in the collective memory, covered by layer upon layer of fertile soil called knowledge.
      
      The Milira had a long period of friendly relations with humans and occasionally guided them in the development of science and technology. However, after a certain incident, the Milira became enemies with humans, and the clouds of war gradually enveloped everyone. A conflict seemed inevitable...
races.name: Milira

races.description:
Industrious humanoids sporting the ears and tails of mammalian beasts - the silkiera. Genome sequencing suggests that they are a mass-produced alteration of the nearmare. 

Engineered as factory workers, silkiera excel at common labor. Beyond that, their practical capabilities are generally inferior to a human's. Like domestic animals, docility and conciliation are part of the silkieran genome. Compared to humans, silkiera consume less food and live long lives in the absence of disease. Unfortunately, their substandard immune systems mean they rarely last to their elderly years.

Silkiera have long since spread beyond their creators' reach. Yet, their inclinations haven't changed much under the freedom of independence. Silkieran colonies on the rim usually have sophisticated production industries. Most often, they specialize in weapon and tool manufacturing.
races.name: silkiera

races.description:
Renowned products of an extensive breeding program - the Silkiera Quality. With a bounty of natural talent and adaptability, they excel at almost every kind of work. Yet like ordinary silkiera, they have no extraordinary powers compared to their sister races.

Silkiera Quality often work as the managers, supervisors and bosses of Ajin Company. Always seeking to avoid potential loss for their company, they tend to stay out of the public eye.

The presence of a Silkiera Quality can be a great boon to a growing colony's workforce. Opportunities to recruit them shouldn't be wasted.
races.name: Silkiera Quality

races.description:
The strongest and cruelest of the silkiera - the "Scheming Race Silkiera Vixenmalice." As Elites among their kind, they are notably more self-serving than their common kin. This allows them to function as the backbone of an otherwise docile race.

Silkiera Vixenmalice occupy the highest executive positions within Ajin Company. Like puppetmasters, they command the public-facing leaders of the company from the shadows.

They are cunning and brutal, fighting with ferocious skill that defies all retribution. Their formidable traits have allowed Ajin Company to thrive despite the odds.

Like all ishmuti, the Silkiera Vixenmalice were once loyal servants of their Creator. But with the latter's fall, no one remained to rein in the Vixenmalice. Thus, they conspired towards one end - the perpetual advancement of Ajin Company. At every oppportunity, their cabals host ominous, frenzied feasts.

As silkieran Elites, Silkiera Vixenmalice exhibit superior physical strength. Moreover, they're innately capable of a unique kind of sorcery. They tend to use curses and nullifying abilities to prolong their enemies' suffering.

Eccentric individuals aside, Vixenmalice are cruel and self-centered by nature. As such, mutual cooperation can be a difficult aim for them. In societies where they live among other races as equals, it's often a challenge to keep peace.
races.name: Silkiera Vixenmalice

races.description:
Draconic humanoids with extraordinary combat abilities - the solark. Ancient records state that the solark were made as the successors to the neclose and xenoorca, their sister races. Solark tend to live primitive, brutal lifestyles since their Creator's fall.

By some unthinkable means, the solark have an organ that acts as a small antimatter reactor. This organ, termed a reactor, allows its owner to create controlled antimatter explosions.

The solark were seemingly engineered with reference to the genomes of prehistoric Earth life forms, lending them large and powerful bodies. Solarkian scales provide strong natural armor, enough to stop many ordinary weapons outright. In raw strength as well, the solark outperform most other races with ease. On some worlds, solark are thought capable of toppling buildings in a single strike.

Unfortunately, solark must consume vast quantities of food to fuel their strong bodies. Moreover, their killer claws lack dexterity, reducing their capacity for skilled labor. This combined with their unique morphology also means they can't use weapons or tools of any kind. Lastly, solark regulate their reactors based on ambient air temperature. As a result, sudden changes in temperature can be hazardous to them. Exposure to open flames in particular is to be avoided at all costs.
races.name: solark

races.description:
An Elite race of solark - the "Dragon Queen Solark Hallelevh." Their design chases the ambitious goal of empowering the already formidable solark. Nonetheless, they were only completed long after the Creator's fall.

Solark Hallelevh have a humanoid form alongside draconic strength and control over antimatter. This permits them to wield weapons and perform most forms of work with relative ease. They also enjoy greater antimatter control, allowing them to flare more often.

The Creator intended the Solark Hallelevh as born leaders with strength to match. Nonetheless, improving on solark design proved to be a difficult feat. Their development required a long period of dormancy where solarkian traits could stabilize in a humanoid body. Though ultimately successful, this dormancy would continue well beyond the Creator's final days.

A Solark Hallelevh's greatest strength is its ability to assume a draconic combat form. This body, composed entirely of antimatter, tears through anything and everything without effort. Meanwhile, the user's true body remains suspended inside the antimatter dragon. This permits them to carry and fire weapons from within.

Beware - though powerful, Solark Hallelevh are ravenous eaters, even compared to their common kin!
races.name: Solark Hallelevh

races.description:
Spectral and incorporeal humanoids - the idhale. They are genetic siblings of the nearmare, apparently produced as a byproduct during the latter's creation. By nature, idhale tend to be pacifistic, sensitive and altruistic. However, they have difficulties viewing themselves as anything but potential slaves.

The idhale are effectively ghosts. Physical attacks pass straight through their bodies, and temperature extremes cannot affect them. Unfortunately, the idhale themselves find it difficult to intentionally touch any physical thing. They thus struggle to perform ordinary tasks, and have special difficulty wielding weapons.

In the age of the ishmutian Creator, the idhale were primarily relegated to sentry duty and common labor. Though the idhale have since spread throughout known space, they maintain a low population. Most now live as the property of slave traders, idly waiting for new masters.
races.name: idhale

races.description:
The ishmutian Creator's final Elite race - the Idhale Avonruach. Even today, details about their kind remain shrouded in mystery. Records that exist revolve around a great war in the ishmuti clade's ancient past. The only tale widely known to the clade describes the Avonruach as "those who destroyed the 'Star-Crossing Bird.'" 

After the war, the Avonruach vanished without a trace. Given the lack of sightings, most concluded that they had gone extinct. Yet in recent years, they've started to appear again. They now organize regular assaults against powerful independent settlements. This continues even against the orders of the Entelechian Royal Bloods.

As the Creator's final creation, their abilities surpass even those of the Royals. They have the power to singlehandedly defeat an army and even defy death. Upon perishing, they shortly resurrect even stronger than they were before.

Like their common kin, an Avonruach's body can nullify attacks. But in exchange for greater offensive performance, this ability is imperfect. It provides full protection against melee attacks, yet only partial protection for ranged attacks.


The Spirits of Iniquity did indeed destroy the Bird. But something was missing inside its corpse. 

On that day, they knew that the seeds of the next calamity had already been sown...
races.name: Idhale Avonruach

races.description:
The ishmutian Creator's final Elite race - the Idhale Avonruach. Even today, details about their kind remain shrouded in mystery. Records that exist revolve around a great war in the ishmuti clade's ancient past. The only tale widely known to the clade describes the Avonruach as "those who destroyed the 'Star-Crossing Bird.'" 

After the war, the Avonruach vanished without a trace. Given the lack of sightings, most concluded that they had gone extinct. Yet in recent years, they've started to appear again. They now organize regular assaults against powerful independent settlements. This continues even against the orders of the Entelechian Royal Bloods.

As the Creator's final creation, their abilities surpass even those of the Royals. They have the power to singlehandedly defeat an army and even defy death. Upon perishing, they shortly resurrect even stronger than they were before.

Like their common kin, an Avonruach's body can nullify attacks. But in exchange for greater offensive performance, this ability is imperfect. It provides full protection against melee attacks, yet only partial protection for ranged attacks.


The Spirits of Iniquity did indeed destroy the Bird. But something was missing inside its corpse. 

On that day, they knew that the seeds of the next calamity had already been sown...
races.name: Idhale Avonruach

races.description:
Amphibious, predatory humanoids with a lower body akin to a marine mammal's - the xenoorca. They are natural born warriors originally created as living bioweapons.

Xenoorca inherit the strong muscles and tough skin of certain Earth marine mammals. Their insulated bodies have a high metabolic rate, causing them to thrive in the cold but suffer in the heat. These factors combine to make the xenoorca a race of ravenous, active huntresses. Like their sister races, the xenoorca also suffer from weak immune systems.

Reflecting their intended purpose, xenoorca tend to be cunning and brutal. Most enjoy the thrill of a hunt and offer their quarry no mercy. Still, some usual or adaptive individuals can learn to live in mixed-race societies. Such communities come to discover a cheerful yet mischievous side of xenoorcan nature.
races.name: xenoorca

races.description:
An Elite subrace of xenoorca - the "Dark Magnate Xenoorca Hadalnoia." Their genome incorporates aspects of the neclose and chaoura's own. Their special abilities pertain to the deep ocean. They also exhibit remarkable hand-to-hand combat prowess, enhanced by their vitality and regeneration.

After a great conflict, the Hadalnoia led the xenoorcan populace into a coup d'tat against the ishmutian state. This, along with a grave charge of "Deicide," led to their banishment. Even in exile, they perpetrated massacres across space. It's thought that the Orcinus Brigade trace their origins from these genocides.

Through the years, Hadalnoia have continued acting as commanders for the Orcinus Brigade. Sometimes they're even spotted on the battlefield, leading the charge against powerful settlements. For their cruelty, Hadalnoia are often called by the title of "Abyssal Mistresses."

Contact with hostile Hadalnoia causes immobilization from the weight of the deep sea. As such, it's best to avoid one-on-one confrontations. If all else fails, focus on eliminating a Hadalnoia's subordinates to force a retreat. 

The Hadalnoia were once the Creator's personal guards, proud and content. It remains unknown why they've been reduced to mere bandits. Yet whispered rumors persist of their quiet, selective killing of littluna.
races.name: Xenoorca Hadalnoia

races.description:
Ishmuti created by the Littluna Dunamis as intimidating guardians - the zoichor. They manage the so-called "Prison Planet Melah," a planetary neighbor to Canaan. 

Melah is a cold world dedicated to the imprisonment of "sinners" captured by Canaan and their allies. As such, zoichor were created with an innate affinity for guard work and freezing temperatures.

Zoichor development involved special data gathered by the chaoura on "Infernal Entities." To control their hellish powers, zoichorian design incorporates eveliet and Dunamis genes alike. As inheritors of the Divine Daughter's and thus the Creator's genes, some consider the zoichor to be his authentic descendants. However, their frightening power makes them a potential liability. Zoichor are thus non-reproductive by design, produced only in specialized bioenginerring plants.

Zoichor are serious and professional by nature, apathetic even when punishing their prisoners. This, alongside Melah's general atmosphere, has earned them a frightening reptuation. Even among ishmuti, many consider zoichor "super scary," "kinda freaky," and "probably into sadism."

The chaoura, an isolationist race by nature, are close with the zoichor alone. Whispered rumors abound chaouran headquarters tucked away in the zoichorian domain of Melah.
races.name: zoichor

races.description: A strange and mysterious reptilian race, known for their connection to an even more mysterious tree called the Hist.
races.name: Argonian
